summary: This is a transcript of a voluntary, sworn interview conducted by DOJ OIG Special Agents with a Federal Correctional Officer (Senior Officer Specialist) from MCC New York. The interview focuses on the officer's knowledge of events surrounding inmate Jeffrey Epstein's time in custody, including his suicide attempt on July 23, 2019, his cell assignments, and the circumstances leading up to his death on August 10, 2019. The officer provides details about Epstein's cell mates, the process for inmate movement and counts, and Epstein's demeanor and phone call on August 9.

connections.description: Were cell mates in Special Housing. Epstein was found with a sheet around his neck in their shared cell on July 23. Epstein later asked to be placed back with Tartaglione.
Were cell mates after Epstein returned from suicide watch. Reyes was moved out of MCC on or around August 9, 2019.
Richman is the attorney and Fooksman is her legal intern, both representing the correctional officer during the OIG interview.
Indirect connection; Richman's client (the officer) had professional interactions with Epstein and his legal team regarding Epstein's PAC number and phone call access.

events.title: Epstein's First Suicide Attempt
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein attempted suicide in his Special Housing Unit cell shared with inmate Tartaglione. Officer found him with a sheet around his neck, sitting on the floor. He was breathing and CPR was initiated.

events.title: Epstein's Final Phone Call
events.description: On the evening before his death, Jeffrey Epstein made an unmonitored phone call from the Special Housing Unit. He told the officer he was happy to have finally gotten the call. The call was authorized by Unit Team or a supervisor.

events.title: Epstein's Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at MCC New York. The officer interviewed was not on duty during this shift.

events.title: Inmate Fernandez Placed in Dry Cell
events.description: Inmate Fernandez was placed in a dry cell in R&D at 3:15 PM, as recorded in the Lieutenant's log. This movement becomes a point of discussion regarding count procedures and potential 'ghost counting.'

events.title: DOJ OIG Interview
events.description: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducts a voluntary, sworn interview with a Federal Correctional Officer from MCC New York as part of its investigation into the death of Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: MCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
Department of Justice Office of Inspector General New York Field Office (interview location)
Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York
R&D (Receiving and Discharge) at MCC New York
keyFacts: The officer was a first responder to Jeffrey Epstein's suicide attempt on July 23, 2019, finding him with a sheet around his neck but sitting on the floor.
Epstein had two known cell mates: first Tartaglione, and after his suicide watch, Efrain Reyes. Reyes was moved out of MCC on or around August 9, 2019.
Epstein made an unmonitored phone call on the evening of August 9, 2019, and expressed happiness about it to the officer. The call was authorized by Unit Team or a supervisor.
The officer states that many decisions regarding Epstein's handling (like cell assignments, suicide watch removal) came from 'outside orders' from judges or lawyers, not standard BOP staff procedure.

The interview delves deeply into BOP count procedures, 'ghost counting,' and document anomalies (like '+1' written on count slips) suggesting potential irregularities in inmate tracking on August 9-10, 2019.
